topicTitle: Entering the Battlefield – QMS Basics & SOP Gap Review
description: Unlock the essentials of Quality Management Systems (QMS) and discover how to identify and fix SOP gaps. This video provides quick, practical insights to boost your organization’s quality and compliance. Perfect for beginners and quality professionals!

topicTitle: Control the Arsenal – Document Versioning & Register Mastery
description: Master the art of document control with this guide on versioning and register management. Learn how to keep your records accurate, up-to-date, and audit-ready, ensuring your organization stays compliant and efficient. Perfect for anyone managing quality or regulatory documents!

topicTitle: Spot the Breach – Deviation Detection & Rapid Reporting
description: Quickly identify deviations and learn rapid reporting techniques to protect your organization’s quality standards. This video covers practical methods to spot breaches early and streamline incident reporting, helping you maintain compliance and prevent bigger issues. Ideal for quality teams and process owners!

topicTitle: Strike Back – Root Cause Analysis & CAPA Drafting
description: Learn how to tackle problems head-on with effective Root Cause Analysis and CAPA drafting. This video shows you how to uncover the real issues behind deviations and create strong corrective and preventive action plans, keeping your quality system robust and proactive. Perfect for professionals aiming to drive continual improvement

topicTitle: First Combat Drill – Internal Audit & Document Inspection Simulation
description: Step into your first quality combat drill with an engaging simulation of internal audits and document inspections. This video guides you through practical techniques for auditing and reviewing documents, helping you build confidence and sharpen your skills for real-world compliance challenges. Ideal for beginners and aspiring auditors!

topicTitle: Defend the Lab – OOS/OOT Identification & First-line Investigation
description: Strengthen your lab’s defenses by mastering OOS (Out of Specification) and OOT (Out of Trend) identification and first-line investigations. This video teaches you how to spot unusual results quickly and initiate effective preliminary actions, safeguarding data integrity and compliance. Perfect for analysts and lab supervisors!

topicTitle: Guard the Data – ALCOA+ & Data Integrity Auditing
description: Learn how to protect your organization’s data with ALCOA+ principles and data integrity auditing. This video explains the pillars of data integrity—Attributable, Legible, Contemporaneous, Original, Accurate, plus additional criteria—and provides practical tips for effective audits. Essential viewing for lab professionals and quality managers!

topicTitle: Full-Scale Operation – Deviation to CAPA Lifecycle Simulation
description: Experience a full-scale quality operation with this simulation of the entire lifecycle from deviation detection to CAPA implementation. This video walks you through each step—identifying a deviation, investigating the root cause, drafting CAPA, and ensuring follow-up—offering practical insights for managing quality events efficiently. Ideal for quality assurance professionals and teams!

topicTitle: The War Game – Integrated QA/QC Crisis Assignment
description: Step into “The War Game” with an integrated QA/QC crisis assignment simulation. This video challenges you to handle real-world quality assurance and quality control emergencies, coordinating rapid responses, investigations, and solutions. Build teamwork, sharpen decision-making, and prepare for any QA/QC crisis!

These are the original records where study data is first captured—like hospital charts, lab reports, or patient diaries. They serve as the backbone for trial data verification.
They’re the “proof” that the study data is real and reliable. If it wasn’t written, it wasn’t done. Regulators and monitors rely on these documents to confirm authenticity.

Typical examples include medical records, hospital charts, laboratory test results, imaging reports, prescriptions, and even patient diaries. Anything that directly records subject data at the time of its creation counts as a source document.

A Case Report Form (CRF) is the structured document where trial data from source documents is transcribed. When used in digital format, it becomes an electronic CRF (eCRF), usually within an electronic data capture (EDC) system, making monitoring, auditing, and data cleaning much more efficient.

The integrity of documentation is built on the ALCOA+ principles: data must be attributable, legible, contemporaneous, original, and accurate, while also being complete, consistent, enduring, and available whenever required. These principles guide how clinical trial data is created and maintained.

topicTitle: Real Role of CRC/CRA in Documentation
description: The Clinical Research Coordinator (CRC) ensures that all trial data is accurately captured from source documents into the CRF, while also maintaining study files. The Clinical Research Associate (CRA), on the other hand, monitors the site, checks CRFs against source data, and ensures that Good Clinical Practice (GCP) standards are consistently followed.

Errors in documentation should never be erased or hidden. Instead, the correct approach is to draw a single line through the incorrect entry, record the correction nearby, and include initials, date, and reason if necessary. In an eCRF, the audit trail system automatically tracks changes, ensuring full transparency.

Frequent errors include late or backdated entries, missing investigator signatures, transcription mistakes when transferring data from source to CRF, and inconsistencies between different documents. These mistakes can compromise data integrity and delay regulatory approvals.
